author: potuz
content: whaaat???

author: potuz
content: ahhh now I read the rest...

author: potuz
content: how can a supermajority client get you slashed?

author: potuz
content: I can see being deadlocked because of it... but not slashed somehow

author: ajsutton
content: By itself it doesn't but if a super majority justifies an invalid chain and attests to it, then you can't return to the correct chain without creating a surrounding vote. So you're either getting slashed or leak just as much. Some will get into the exit queue early and escape but there will be a huge loss to get the correct chain finalizing.  Same as with a super majority CL.

author: potuz
content: ahh ok, for a little bit I thought there was a slashing I couldn't understand.

author: marekm3498
content: Ok, we found and resolved this problem too. It was problem with eth_getLogs and empty blocks. We returned {"jsonrpc":"2.0","error":{"code":-32001,"message":"Receipt not available for 'From' block '12330881'."},"id":1719} for an empty block incorrectly. We merged fix to master and added it to docker image: nethermindeth/nethermind:ropsten We plan to release the fix soon.

author: fab_10
content: Hi <@&595681771690000403> we are seeing a lot of these warnings `Jun-08 16:49:35.693[SYNC]             warn: Pruned 1 pending blocks from UnknownBlockSync` on our Besu-Lodestar combo on Ropsten, something to worry about?

author: g11tech
content: these warnings are pretty harmless if the client is synced and moving forward, the only downside is we might be penalizing peers

author: g11tech
content: we are looking into the issue why we are seemingly retrying the same block segment to sync

author: fab_10
content: currently everything seems fine, tnx

author: seamonkey82
content:
Only ~~two~~ three issues I'm observing across all 20 client pairs at the moment are:
prysm-erigon
```
Unable to process past deposit contract logs: Could not process deposit log: received incorrect merkle index: wanted 0 but got 356
```
All lodestar instance throwing `Pruned 1 pending blocks` message referenced above

teku-erigon
erigon stalled syncing pre-merge and needed to be restarted

author: parithosh
content:
hmm, i see this in my prysm-erigon:
```
time="2022-06-08 20:44:49" level=debug msg="Could not get an up to date eth1 header" error="eth1 head is more than 20m0s behind from current wall clock time" prefix=powchain
```
But it seems to still propose fine, might be a logging issue. 

My teku-erigon seems fine, its still at head and following the chain as expected. I guess it could be related to the pre-merge stall you saw. 

As 11crygpt said, I see lodestar downscoring peers and having fewer of them. But no other consequence of the log message you posted.

I'm extremely glad that you had all the client pairs running, its suuuuper useful to cross check if its an isolated config issue or not. Thanks for your work!
